intro.description:
Welcome to verinice!
This tutorial will help you to configure verinice and guide you along the first few steps.

item.title: Switch to ISM perspective
item.description:
Since you're reading this in English, we assume that you wish to use the ISM perspective. This perspective allows you to model requirements and controls, to calculate risk and generate reports.
Open the ISM perspective by clicking the menu item View > Show Perspective... > ISM Perspective.

item.title: Import control catalog
item.description:
First you need to import a control catalog. You have to import the catalog file. On the left-hand side of the verinice workbench you will find the "Catalogs" view. Click the leftmost button ("Import catalog...").
Choose your downloaded or manually created (e.g. using Excel or OpenOffice) catalog file and click OK.

item.title: Create a scope
item.description:
The catalog is now being loaded. After the parser has finished, you will see the contents in the catalog view.
Open the browser view (View > Show View > Object Browser). Click a control to show its contents in the browser view.
To actually work with the imported controls, you have to create your organization in the database. Go to the view "Information Security Model". It should be displayed in the middle of the verinice workbench. Click the rightmost button ("Add new organization"").
Drag some controls from the catalog view to the "Controls" group underneath your new organization. The controls will be created. Double-click them to open the editor for each control.
item.onCompletion: Excellent! If you want to continue, you'll find more tutorials in the Help menu.
